Welcome to Pessum’s documentation!¶

struct Pos¶
#include <types.hpp>

Structure to contains position/size data.

Contains the x, y positional data, and the width, height size data.

Public Functions

Pos()¶

Creates new position.

Creates position with zero for all terms

Pos(int value_x, int value_y)¶

Creates new position.

Creates position with set x and y position, and width and height are set to zero

Parameters
  • value_x: Value for the X position.
  • value_y: Value for the y position.

Pos(int value_x, int value_y, int value_w, int value_h)¶

Creates new position.

Creates position data with set x, y, width, and height data

Parameters
  • value_x: Value for the x position.
  • value_y: Value for the y position.
  • value_w: Value for the width.
  • value_h: Value for the height.

Public Members

int x¶

X term of the position data.

int y¶

Y term of the position data.

int w¶

Width term for the position data.

int h¶

Height term for the position data.

struct Var¶
#include <types.hpp>

Structure to use as general variable.

Structure that can act as a variable for int, double, string, or bool

Public Functions

Var()¶

Creates new Var.

Creates the default variable, with standard values for all terms.

Var(int value)¶

Creates new Var.

Creates new integer variable.

Parameters
  • value: Integer value for variable.

Creates new Var.

Creates new double variable.

Parameters
  • value: Double value for variable.

Creates new Var.

Creates new string variable.

Parameters
  • value: String value for variable.

Parameters
  • value: Boolian value for variable.

  • value: Integer value for variable.

  • value: Double value for variable.

  • value: String value for variable.

class Window¶
#include <window.hpp>

Core of everything output to the console.

The Window class is the base of everything that is output to the console. Everything output must be part of a window, and the windows controll all outputs, and output attributes.

Public Functions

Window()¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window with the same base setting of std_scr.

See
std_scr

Window(int width, int height)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window with given width and height, at 0,0.

Parameters
  • width: Width of window.
  • height: Height of window.

Window(double width, double height)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window with width and height as a percentage of std_scr.

See
std_scr
Parameters
  • width: Percentage of width.
  • height: Percentage of height.

Window(int width, int height, int pos_x, int pos_y)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window with given width and height, at given position.

Parameters
  • width: Width of window.
  • height: Height of window.
  • pos_x: X position of window.
  • pos_y: Y position of window.

Window(int width, int height, double pos_x, double pos_y)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window with given width and height, and at x and y of percentage of std_scr.

See
std_scr
Parameters
  • width: Width of window.
  • height: Height of window.
  • pos_x: Percentage of width.
  • pos_y: Percentage of height.

See
std_scr
Parameters
  • width: Percentace of width.
  • height: Percentage of height.
  • pos_x: Percentage of width.
  • pos_y: Percentage of height.

Parameters

void Update()¶

Updates window display.

Updates the window display, to show recently printed outputs. Must be called for display to be visible.

void ToggleBorder()¶

Toggles drawing window border.

Toggles wether the window border should be drawn.

void ToggleScroll()¶

Toggles window scrolling.

Toggles if the window should handle last line output by scrolling.

void ToggleTitle(std::string setting = "")¶

Toggles window title.

Toggles wether the window title should be drawn.

Parameters
  • setting: String to set as the new window title.

void SetAutoUpdate(bool setting = true)¶

Sets window auto updating.

Sets window auto updating to specified value.

Parameters
  • setting: Value to set auto updating to.

Enables a color for output.

Enables output color.

Parameters
  • attrs: Color index represented by a two digit number.

void ColorOff(int attrs)¶

Disables a color for output.

Disables previously enabled output color.

Parameters
  • attrs: Color index represented by a two digit number.

Enables an attribute for output.

Enables output attribute.

See
Attrs
Parameters
  • attrs: Attribute value from Attrs.

See
Attrs
Parameters
  • attrs: Attribute value from Attrs.

void SetColor(int color, int value)¶

Sets display color of window part.

Sets the color of compnents of the window.

Parameters
  • color: Color represented by two digit number.
  • value: Window component to color.

void Clear(bool all = false)¶

Clears window of outputs.

Clears window of all ouputs.

Parameters
  • all: If true, then clears window of border and title aswell.

void ClearLine(int line = -1)¶

Clears the current line of window.

Clears the current line of cursor y, and sets cursor x to begining of the line.

Parameters
  • line: Specify line to clear.

int Print(std::string str, ...)¶

Print output to window.

Main output function for ostendo. str is a formated string such as for printf, with additional arguments as required. Accepts additional excape sequenced initialized with a ‘#’. ‘#o__’ will turn on specified attribute, while ‘#f__’ will turn off the specified attribute. Attributes can be two digit numbers (0-7)(0-7), where the first number is the forground color, and the second number is the backround color. These attributes can also be any of the following: ac(alternate character set), bl(blink), bo(bold), di(dim), in(invisible), pr(protected), re(reverse), st(standout), un(underlined).

Return
-1 if window has not been initialized, otherwise 0.
Parameters
  • str: Format string.
  • ...: Additional arguments as required.

void SetCurs(int y = -1, int x = -1)¶

Sets cursor position in window.

Sets the position of the output cursor for the window.

Parameters
  • x: X position of the cursor.
  • y: Y position of the cursor.

WINDOW *operator()()¶

Gets ncurses window pointer.

Gets the ncurses window pointer for the current window.

Return
pointer to ncurses window.

Public Members

Pos window_space¶

Window space avalible for output (Excluding borders/title).

Private Functions

void GenWindow()¶

Creates ncurses window.

Genorates the ncurses window based off of set values for window size and position.

See
NewWindow(), Window(), window_pos

void DrawBorder()¶

Draws window border.

Draws the window border if window_border is true.

See
window_border, ToggleBorder()

void DrawTitle()¶

Draws window title.

Draws the set title for window if window_title is true.

See
window_title, ToggleTitle()

void LastLine()¶

Handles output when window is full.

If window_scroll is true, then all previous outputs are shifted up one line, to alow for another line of output, otherwise the window is cleared, and the cursor is placed in the top left.

See
window_scroll, Printf(), ToggleScroll()

bool IsInt(char ch)¶

Checks if charicter is an integer value.

Checks if given character is an integer.

Return
true if the charcter is an integer.
Parameters
  • ch: Character to check.

Private Members

Determines if the window border should be drawn.

bool window_title = false¶

Determines if the window title should be drawn.

bool window_scroll = false¶

Determines if the window scrolls when output reaches the end.

bool auto_update = true¶

Determines if the window should update after every output.

namespace ostendo¶

Core namespace for all Ostendo methods.

Enums

enum VarType¶

Declares the posible types of the variable structure.

Values:

INT = 0¶

Sets the variable type to be integer

DOUBLE = 1¶

Sets the variable type to be doubles

STRING = 2¶

Sets the variable type to be strings

BOOL = 3¶

Sets the variable type to be boolians

enum WINDOW_PARTS¶

Declaration for different components of the window.

Values:

WIN_BORDER = 1¶

Selects the window border.

WIN_TITLE = 2¶

Selects the window title.

WIN_TEXT = 3¶

Selects the window test.

WIN_BACKGROUND = 4¶

Selects the window background.

enum ATTRS¶

Declaration for different output attributes.

Values:

ALTCHAR = 1¶

Uses alternate character set.

BLINK = 2¶

Sets output to blinking (If posible in terminal emulator).

BOLD = 3¶

Sets output to bold.

DIM = 4¶

Sets output to dim colors.

INVIS = 5¶

Sets output text to be invisable.

PROTECT = 5¶

Sets output mode to protected.

REVERSE = 6¶

Sets output to reverse mode.

STANDOUT = 7¶

Sets output to be heighlighted.

UNDERLINE = 8¶

Sets output to be underlined.

Functions

std::vector<ostendo::Var> Form(ostendo::Window win, std::vector<Var> fields)¶

Simple form function to get several inputs from the user. This function takes a window, and a set of inputs to request of the user. After the user enters the values for the requested inputs, the values are returned.

Return
Vector of Var‘s filled with user input.
See
Window, Var
Parameters
  • win: Window to use for displaying inputs.
  • fields: Vector of Var‘s for taking in input from the user.

std::string GetVarStr(Var in_var, int width)¶

Gets the string representation of the variable to display. This function reads the Var object, and creates a string to represent the data stored by the object.

Return
String representation of in_var.
See
Var.
Parameters
  • in_var: Var to interpret.
  • width: Maximum width for return string.

std::string Menu(ostendo::Window win, std::vector<std::string> options)¶

Menu function for selecting an option from a set. This function takes a set of options, and a window, then provides a simple user interface for selecting one of the provided options. This selected option is then returned.

Return
String from selected option of Options.
See
Window
Parameters
  • win: Window to use to display all options.
  • options: Options that the user must select from.

void InitOstendo(bool color = false, int time_out = -1)¶

Initializes Ostendo/Ncurses.

Initializes ncurses with default settings, and enables keypad input, and reads std_scr data. Optionaly enables color, disables cursor, and sets input timeout time.

See
std_scr, windows, color_init, TermOstendo()
Parameters
  • color: Determines if colors should be enabled.
  • cursor: Determines if cursor should be disabled.
  • time_out: Sets the time out time for intput. -1 for no time out.

void TermOstendo()¶

Terminates Ostendo/Ncurses.

Terminates ncurses, and returns the console to standard settings.

See
InitOstendo()

void InitWindow(std::string name)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window, and adds it to windows. The window has the same dimensions of std_scr.

See
windows, std_scr
Parameters
  • name: The name of the window for the key in windows map.

void InitWindow(std::string name, int width, int height)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window, and adds it to windows. The window is positioned at 0,0 with given width and height.

See
windows, std_scr
Parameters
  • name: The name of the window for the key in windows map.
  • width: The width of the window in characters.
  • height: The height of the window in characters.

void InitWindow(std::string name, int width, int height, int x, int y)¶

Creates a new window.

Creates a new window, and adds it to windows. The window is at a given position with a given width and height.

See
windows, std_scr
Parameters
  • name: The name of the window for the key in windows map.
  • width: The width of the window in characters.
  • height: The height of the window in characters.
  • x: The x position of the window in characters from the left.
  • y: the y position of the window in characters from the top.

void TermWindow(std::string name)¶

Terminates a window.

Termainates a specified window from the windows map.

See
windows
Parameters
  • name: The name of the window to be deleted.

color_init

std::string TextBox(ostendo::Window win, std::string base = "")¶

Function for basic extended text entry from user. This function alows the user to write text to a text box, and when compleated, the writen text is formated into a string.

Return
String of what user entered.
See
Window
Parameters
  • win: window to display to.
  • base: Starting string to display in text box.

Return
String of what user entered.
See
Window
Parameters
  • win: window to display to.
  • base: Starting vector of strings representing different lines of text.

std::vector<std::string> VTextBox(ostendo::Window win, std::string base = "")¶

Function for basic extended text entry from user. This function alows the user to write text to a text box, and when compleated, the writen text is formated into a a vector of strings, each representing a lines of text.

Return
Vector of strings representing the different lines of input from the user.
See
Window
Parameters
  • win: window to display to.
  • base: Starting string to display in text box.

std::vector<std::string> VTextBox(ostendo::Window win, std::vector<std::string> base)¶

Function for basic extended text entry from user. This function alows the user to write text to a text box, and when compleated, the writen text is formated into a a vector of strings, each representing a lines of text.

Return
Vector of strings representing the different lines of input from the user.
See
Window
Parameters
  • win: window to display to.
  • base: Starting vector of stirngs representing different lines of text.

void DisplayLines(ostendo::Window win, std::vector<std::string> lines, int current_line, int &start_line)¶

Displays lines from a vector of strings. Displays the lines from a vector of string to a given window, and auto centers the current line, so that it is always on screen.

See
Window
Parameters
  • win: Window to display to.
  • lines: Vector of string to display.
  • current_line: Current line to center in window.
  • start_line: line of vector to begin display from.
